French unions lead massive strike over budget policies and anti-Macron anger
subhead: The Interior Ministry said more than 506,000 people demonstrated in France, while the CGT trade union counted 'more than a million' demonstrators. New Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu assured that 'the demands made by representatives of the trade union organizations and relayed by the demonstrators are at the heart of the consultations that I have initiated.'

Trump versus the media: Print stands firm while ABC suspends host Jimmy Kimmel
subhead: Leveraging the shock following Charlie Kirk's assassination to intensify his war on the media, Donald Trump filed a defamation lawsuit against the New York Times, which he called 'Radical Left Media,' and hailed host Jimmy Kimmel's suspension.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: French PM Lecornu's mission: Ease tensions, to salvage what can be saved
subhead: It is telling that, from his first day as French prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu has sought to demonstrate the much-disputed efficiency of the state and its ability to chart a clear path, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Previously unknown Picasso portrait revealed in Paris
subhead: The colorful oil painting, entitled 'Bust of a woman with a flowery hat,' depicts Dora Maar, an artist and Pablo Picasso's muse. It is being put up for auction in Paris, with a reserve price of €8 million.

title: Why prosecutors want PSG's Achraf Hakimi to stand trial for rape
subhead: Prosecutors requested in August that PSG's vice-captain stand trial for rape, according to a final indictment seen by Le Monde.
byline: By Rémi Dupré and Jérôme Lefilliâtre

title: Le Pen's RN says it wants power, but acts like it fears it
subhead: Marine Le Pen and Jordan Bardella's statements about whether they would seek to govern after new snap elections raise questions about their true willingness to wield power before the 2027 presidential election.

title: An abbey in southern France rescued by contemporary art
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (6/6). Le Monde explores six art centers set up in unusual locations. Today: a magnificent Cistercian abbey rescued from ruin by Geneviève Bonnefoi and Pierre Brache.

title: French border police accused of causing shipwrecks and deaths of migrants from Comoros
subhead: Since 2010, several hundred Comorians have died at sea while trying to reach the French overseas territory of Mayotte. A joint investigation by Le Monde and Lighthouse Reports shows that police maneuvers are implicated in several of these shipwrecks.
byline: By Raphaëlle Aubert, Julia Pascual (Mayotte), Jack Sapoch (motion design, Lighthouse Reports), Tomas Statius (Mayotte, Lighthouse Reports) and Maud Jullien (Lighthouse Reports)
